prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We propose continuum mapping in band 7 at the standard frequency of 343.5GHZ. Band 7 is choosen to correspond to the band used in a previous stacking analysis of the sample. This ensures that the flux estimates are robust. No high spectral resolution data is requested.

A resolution of 0.2 arcsec is required to resolve the star-formation structure of the target galaxies. The largest angular scale is required to resolve more diffuse star-formation which may be associated with the larger galaxies in the sample. Using simalm in CASA it was found that, 5 minutes per source (split evenly between cycle 3 configuration 2 and 5) was found to be sufficient to effectively recover flux both for extended disks and clumpy galaxies. This achieved a noise level 100 uJy/beam in the briggs robust=0 map.

The sensitivity estimate is based on stacked values from the ALESS survey (Hodge et al., 2013), finding an average flux of 2.4 mJy per galaxy. The aim of this proposal is to resolve the galaxy, and measure flux of star-forming clumps, with estimated fluxes of 25% of the galaxies.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose to use ALMA band 7 to map the continuum emission for a sample of BzK galaxies at z~1.4-2.5. BzK galaxies have generally been found to lie on the main sequence of star formation found for high-redshift galaxies, and as such represent a very different population of galaxies to the typically studied SMGs. By resolved mapping of our sample we will be able to gain insight into the proccesses that govern star formation in the main-sequence.
The fraction of the chooosen sample has been studied previously using stacking, and found to have an average flux. Mapping down to a 1 sigma rms of 100 uJy will allow us to detect clumps at the target scale of 0.2 arcsec (~1.5kpc). The BzK sample is combined from the previous stacking sample in the ALESS survey as well as high stellar mass galaxies from the full ECDFS. This will also allow us to study why the ALESS BzKs stacked fluxes were higher than expected for BzKs.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
